Dr Kieny: Clinical trials for candidate #Ebola vaccine safety in children will likely take place in Africa
Dr Kieny: Volunteers to the current candidate #Ebola vaccine clinical trials are healthy adults, 18-65 years old
Dr Kieny: Normal development of a vaccine takes years. Development of #Ebola vaccines has been accelerated
Dr Kieny: You cannot get #Ebola by #taking the candidate #Ebola vaccines
Dr Kieny: Volunteers for candidate #Ebola vaccine in Lausanne to receive 2 doses; in Geneva 5 doses [different candidate vaccines]
Dr Kieny: Clinical trials from lead candidate #Ebola vaccines to involve abt 250 volunteers. Half of them in Switzerland (Lausanne, Geneva)
Dr Kieny: #Ebola vaccine [once clinical trials are completed] is expected to be use in West Africa early 2015
Dr Kieny: People [live in the countries mentioned earlier] can volunteer for the candidate #Ebola vaccine clinical trials
Dr Kieny: Initial data from the candidate #Ebola vaccine clinical trials are expected to be available in December
Dr Kieny: What's important from the candidate #Ebola vaccine clinical trials are not only safety, but also to know the right dose level
Dr Kieny: Another lead #Ebola vax - which was donated to WHO, clinical trials in the U.S., also Germany, Switzerland (Geneva), Gabon, Kenya
Dr Kieny: One of lead candidate #Ebola vax is currently going thru clinical trial in the U.S., Oxford, Mali. In Lausanne, Switzerland in Nov
